entry.title: Minute entry from 2026-01-14 in Morand v. Tesla, Inc., 1:25-cv-01213
entry.summary: Text Order GRANTING 12 Joint Case Management Motion Regarding Schedule for Amended Complaint and Responses entered by Judge Robert Pitman. IT IS ORDERED that Lead Plaintiffs shall file an amended complaint on or before February 17, 2026; Defendants shall answer or otherwise respond on or before April 20, 2026; Lead Plaintiffs shall file any brief in opposition to Defendants' motions to dismiss on or before June 22, 2026; and Defendants shall file any reply in support of such motions on or before August 6, 2026. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (JMlc)

entry.title: Entry #8 in Morand v. Tesla, Inc., 1:25-cv-01213
entry.summary: ORDER GRANTING Movants Gandhi and Soto's Joint 7 Stipulation and Proposed Order Appointing Co-Lead Plaintiffs and Co-Lead Counsel. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Soto and Gandhi are APPOINTED to serve as Co-Lead Plaintiffs in this action pursuant to Section 21D(a)(3)(B) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, 15 U.S.C. ยง 78u-4(a)(3)(B), as amended by the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Soto and Gandhis joint selection of Co-Lead Counsel is APPROVED. Levi & Korinsky, LLP and Pomerantz LLP are APPOINTED as Co-Lead Counsel for the Class. The Brisco Law Firm, PLLC is APPOINTED as liaison counsel for the Class. Signed by Judge Robert Pitman. (cnr) (Entered: 12/10/2025)

entry.title: Minute entry from 2025-09-04 in Morand v. Tesla, Inc., 1:25-cv-01213
entry.summary: Text Order GRANTING 3 Joint Motion entered by Judge Robert Pitman. IT IS ORDERED that the parties shall adhere to the terms and schedule agreed upon in their submission. Specifically, IT IS ORDERED that the parties shall submit a proposed schedule for the filing of a consolidated or amended complaint and Defendants' response thereto on or before 10 days following the appointment of a lead plaintiff and the Court's approval of lead counsel. The Court advises the parties that all future requests regarding deadlines must be submitted as a motion, rather than a stipulation. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (aclc)
